p: According to the Center for Disease and Control Prevention, “229E, NL63, OC43, and HKU1 are the most common human coronaviruses out of the seven viruses identified” [ 2]. COVID-19, first identified in China, is a new strain of coronaviruses that has not been previously identified in humans but was linked to animal sources. The virus is believed to be transmitted from animals to humans at first, and then from humans to humans through airborne droplets of infected patients' fluids, which has led the virus to infect and kill thousands of people and to raise international concern.
